resources.string:
Every racquet model has different density of the strings in the center of the racquet head.
Measure with a ruler the distances "a" and "b" in millimetres between 2 neighbouring main and 2 neighbouring cross strings in the center of the racquet head.
Calculate the average area "S" of one string opening in the head center:
S=a.b
Choose the corresponding String opening size:
Every Stringer in combination with his Stringing machine, strings with a certain degree of tightness.\nChoose the degree of tightness of the Stinger/Stringing machine.
Head size should be between %1$d and %2$d %3$s.

Every racquet model, string model and stringer have unique characteristics. The “Calibration” completely takes them into account:
 1. Take a newly strung racquet.
 2. Preset all known racquet and string parameters.
 3. Hit the string close to the microphone.
 4. “Calibrate” the App by entering the average tension between main and cross strings applied by the stringer.

The full capacity of TennisTension can be understood and reached when is used with the provided proper Calibration. There are several important factors to consider:


Tension Loss - starts during stringing and is at very high rate during the first couple of hours after stringing and during the first 30 minutes of play.


Type and model of the string with all its characteristics.


Stringing machine


Stringer abilities and stringing habits

To make your perfect calibration you have to pick a racquet with your string strung by a trusted stringer at desired tension couple of hours after stringing. Enter the racquet and string parameters in the settings. Tap the string anywhere with anything close to the phone microphone. The microphone could be either at the top or at the bottom of the phone. After you see that the Factory measurement is done, push the Calibrate button and enter the preknown average tension between the main and cross strings, which you gave to your trusted stringer in advance. Now the Calibration is done,you can see the amendment of the measurements and TennisTension is ready for use in a mode with Calibration.

For best results use the app in places with less noise!\n
The user has to learn how to produce the proper ringing sound CLOSE (2 to 10 cm) and IN FRONT of the phone microphone. Find the microphone which uses single, very small hole either at the TOP or at the BOTTOM of the phone.\n
REMOVE the dampener - if you have.\n
Do not touch the strings with your fingers while measuring.\n
Tap the racquet strings VERY GENTLY ANYWHERE several times every 1 or 2 sec. with ANY STIFF object. KEEP the resonating RINGING strings CLOSE (2 to 10 cm) and IN FRONT OF the phone microphone. The best way is with a pen or pencil, or use another racquet, fingernails, etc. It is shown well in the YouTube video https://youtu.be/PNTyjG7jr98 provided for TennisTension mobile app, Google Play Store or on www.tennistension.app\n
To receive the exact momentous string tension, define all the necessary racquet and string parameters. If you don\'t know some of them, default average values are taken for the calculations or the last values that the user put it in.\n
TennisTension measures the average tension between main and cross strings of the racquet. For example, if a racquet is strung 25/24 kg, the measurement result will be 24.5 kg.\n
String tensions of hybrid strings could be measured as well. In this case, define the parameters of both main and cross strings.\n
The error of the measurement result is less than 0.2 kg when the accurate racquet, string, and stringer/stringing machine parameters are set.\n
A Calibration for the app is provided in the case you want to cope COMPLETELY and SIMULTANEOUSLY with ALL specific characteristics of your PERSONAL racquet and string model. In this case, use a TRUSTED stringer
heavy polyester\nless stretchable; higher density ingredients
light polyester\nmore stretchable; lower density ingredients
light synthetic\nmore stretchable; lower density ingredients
The app is unusable without permissions for the microphone. Do you want to use this app?
